summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between FBI personnel discussing the process of applying for Continued Presence (CP) status for a victim in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It reveals coordination between the FBI's New York Field Office and the Department of Justice regarding victim support procedures.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.role: FBI personnel (likely Victim Specialist or agent)
persons.context: Mentioned as someone to be included in a conference call regarding the Continued Presence application for an Epstein case victim.

persons.name: Melody
persons.role: FBI personnel overseeing the Continued Presence Program
persons.context: Previously oversaw the CP Program and is contacted for guidance on the application process and timeframe for an Epstein case victim.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel involved in the victim assistance process, with Melody providing program guidance to Mandy's team.

events.title: Meeting with Epstein victim to complete CP paperwork
events.description: The FBI case agent and a victim specialist met with a victim in the Jeffrey Epstein case to complete paperwork for a Continued Presence application.

events.title: Inquiry about Continued Presence program for Epstein victim
events.description: FBI personnel from the New York Field Office contacted the DOJ/FBI CP program to inquire about the application process and timeframe for a victim in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively pursuing Continued Presence (CP) status for a victim in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of July 2020, indicating ongoing victim support efforts.
Continued Presence is a program for victims of severe forms of human trafficking (forced labor or commercial sex acts) that requires meeting specific definitions.
The turnaround time for ICE to approve a CP application could be as high as six weeks, indicating a bureaucratic process.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI field agents, victim specialists, and DOJ program administrators regarding victim assistance procedures.
The document references specific FBI personnel (though some names/email addresses are partially redacted) involved in the Epstein victim support process.
